results.byline: By Nicholas Nehamas and Alexandra Berzon
results.title: DeSantis Bluntly Acknowledges Trump’s 2020 Defeat: ‘Of Course He Lost’
results.abstract: “Joe Biden’s the president,” the Florida governor said in an interview with NBC News. He and other Republican presidential candidates have been testing new lines of attack against Donald Trump.

media.caption: Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida has been trying to reset his struggling campaign, and his donors have pushed him to moderate his positions to appeal to a broader audience.
media.copyright: Rachel Mummey for The New York Times

results.title: Judge Throws Out Trump’s Countersuit Against E. Jean Carroll
results.abstract: The former president argued that Ms. Carroll, a former columnist, should not have said that he raped her after a jury found him liable for sexual abuse.

media.caption: The judge wrote that most people would describe Donald Trump’s actions as rape, even if they did not meet the legal definition of the term.
media.copyright: Maddie McGarvey for The New York Times

results.title: Kamala Harris Takes on a Forceful New Role in the 2024 Campaign
results.abstract: The vice president is trying to reclaim the momentum that propelled her to Joseph R. Biden Jr.’s side as a candidate and into the White House in 2020.

results.title: Anguish in Camelot: Kennedy Campaign Roils Storied Political Family
results.abstract: The presidential bid by Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has tested the bonds of an iconic Democratic clan that does not want him to run and does not know what to do about it.

media.caption: Robert F. Kennedy Jr., announcing his campaign for the Democratic presidential nomination in April. Many in the Kennedy family are pained by his candidacy and vaccine conspiracy theories.

results.byline: By Alan Rappeport and Madeleine Ngo
results.title: Trucking Firm That Got $700 Million U.S. Bailout Declares Bankruptcy
results.abstract: A pandemic-era lifeline that the Trump administration predicted would turn a profit for the federal government failed to keep Yellow afloat.

media.caption: The trucking industry has been under pressure over the last year from rising interest rates and higher fuel costs, which it has struggled to pass on to shippers.

results.title: Are G.O.P. Voters Tiring of the War on ‘Wokeness’?
results.abstract: New polling shows national Republicans and Iowa Republican caucusgoers were more interested in “law and order” than battling “woke” schools, media and corporations.

media.caption: Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida once used “woke” five times in 19 seconds. His Republican rival Vivek Ramaswamy, right, has a book titled “Woke Inc.” But the word might not resonate with voters the way they think.
media.copyright: Christopher Smith and Jon Cherry for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Facial Recognition Software;Police;False Arrests, Convictions and Imprisonments;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Black People;internal-sub-only;Robberies and Thefts;Woodruff, Porcha;Police Department (Detroit, Mich);Detroit (Mich)
results.title: Eight Months Pregnant and Arrested After False Facial Recognition Match
results.abstract: Porcha Woodruff thought the police who showed up at her door to arrest her for carjacking were joking. She is the first woman known to be wrongfully accused as a result of facial recognition technology.

media.caption: Porcha Woodruff, 32, of Detroit, said she gestured at her stomach when the police arrived at her house to indicate how ill-equipped she was to commit a robbery and carjacking.
media.copyright: Nic Antaya for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Bears;Animals;Wildlife Sanctuaries and Nature Reserves;internal-open-access-from-nl;South Lake Tahoe (Calif);California;Colorado
results.title: Hank the Tank, a 400-Pound Bear Behind Lake Tahoe Break-Ins, Is Captured
results.abstract: A female bear — and one of three known as Hank — was captured with her three cubs by California wildlife authorities. She was responsible for at least 21 home break-ins, officials said.

media.caption: A female bear known as 64F turned out to be the most notorious of the bears known as Hank the Tank that were involved in property damage in Tahoe Keys.
media.copyright: California Department of Fish and Wildlife, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Border Barriers;Native Americans;Immigration and Emigration;Illegal Immigration;Border Patrol (US);Arizona
results.title: Killing of Native American Man Stirs Anger at Border Patrol
results.abstract: Raymond Mattia was shot nine times by agents late one night outside his home on tribal lands in Arizona.

media.caption: The fence at the U.S. and Mexico Border on the Tohono O’odham Nation near Sells, Arizona. The nation straddles the U.S.-Mexico border, and some tribal members complain about their treatment by border agents.
media.copyright: Rebecca Noble for The New York Times

results.title: A New Frontier for Travel Scammers: A.I.-Generated Guidebooks
results.abstract: Shoddy guidebooks are flooding Amazon. Their authors claim to be renowned travel writers, but are they A.I. inventions? And how big is the problem?
